description: I love this hole-in-the-wall place.  We've been coming here at least 1-2 times a month for the past two years or so for their pho-ga and banh-mi.  Sure, we've had plenty of pho-ga and banh-mi from other places but we always end up comparing it to Sunrise.  Nuff said.
author: Tara C.

description:
I was starting to like this place, but today changed my mind.  

I ordered the #17- shrimp vermicelli with imperial roll- to go.   When I got back to my office, I opened the box and the shrimp was a huge disappointment.  They only gave me three sad small under cooked shrimp.  

Boo!  

I'm over this place.  The prices sucks for what you get.
author: michelle D.

description: I love this place. Mainly because its location, but also because the pulled pork really is the best I have had.
author: LJ O.

description: Went over there the other day during Come Out & Play, got my standard tofu sandwich and was reminded why I used to come here pretty much every time my old band practiced at nearby Lennon Studios.  The owner/manager (?) guy who's generally there is incredibly nice, and my sandwich has always been tasty and affordable.
author: Sean M.

description: Fantastic Bahn Mi at great prices in a modest establishment. Def worth your time.
author: Ben W.

description: Best place for lunch on the go, one reason important reason why. Let me tell you, it's the BBQ Pork Vietnamese Sandwich.  They're fast and affordable!
author: Terrine B.

description:
I came here for lunch a few days ago. I was craving a banh mi and this was the closest thing I could find by my worker. They also serve pho and other American good.

The atmosphere isn't the greatest. It's outdated and a fresh coat and paint and new chairs and tables will definitively help. You order at the counter, grab your own soda and then sit down. They bring the food to your table. 

I ordered a beef banh mi and it was okay. The pork had good flavor. The baguette was a little chewy. I wish there was more Daikon and vegetables. For the price, it was well worth it!
author: Brian W.

description:
Anyone that works on my end of SoMa knows that food pickings are few & far between...one can only do the Costco hot dog but for so long...lol  

Korso/Sunrise Cafe is aiite with me, though...the young man that works behind the counter is a sweetie, the imperial rolls slap & the thai iced tea is bomb; my only suggestions are more food with the vermacelli plates, & more RARE beef with the Rare Beef/Well Done Flank soup, PLEASE?!
author: Amoura B.

description:
Great sandwiches, egg rolls and Vietnamese coffee. Better bahn mi than Saigon Sandwich. Seriously! I favor either the BBQ pork or their fantastic tofu.

I come by once a week to get my fix. Friendly service and a calm spot near the freeway to relax and munch on yummy, cheap Vietnamese grub! Love you, Sunrise!
author: Alison S.

description: Came here a tad before lunch hour and managed to dodge the lunch hour rush. I got the vermicelli with grilled pork and imperial rolls. It was good, the pork was grilled nicely with a bit of char and the imperial rolls were spot on. The service was fast albeit a tad inattentive but I can overlook it since lunch hour has this place lined out the door. Definitely see myself coming back again if I'm craving some Vietnamese.
author: Richard C.

description: I like this place - I tried the spicy pho and wasn't impressed the first time, not sure why I thought I should be doing anything other than pouring sriracha into my normal dish anyway.  decent fast not expensive
author: Scott S.

description:
Keep in mind that this is SOMA, I'm wearing heels and mostly likely a skirt, and lunch is like a mini vacation in the middle of the week.  I don't get to go out for lunch frequently.  I don't take lunch every day.  Lunch time is sometimes the hour when I get the most work done because everyone else has gone and it's quiet.  

One day last week, I managed to take a full hour for lunch.  That's an incredible feat!  It's as if the planets lined up.  Anyways.  It was not too warm and Erica came with me.  We walked the few blocks to this location, talking about boys the whole time.    It was worth the few minutes of walking, the day was fine, and I was in a good mood.

The food here was much better than the place around the corner from work.  The benefit of the place around the corner is that it's literally around the corner.  But when you walk just a few blocks away, this food is much better.  It's the same price and it doesn't cost another dollar to add the egg roll.  This bun came with 2 egg rolls.  Erica and I shared the chicken bun.  The chicken was juicy and tender and flavorful.  The serving was huge.  Heaping mound.  

The sh*t thing was that the waitress bringing me my food dripped the fish sauce on my new ivory jacket.  This is why I can't have nice things.  

As far as work-distance foods, this was such a good deal.
author: Christina C.

description:
Just like my review for chow's kitchen on utah... sunrise cafe is one of my lunch hot spots. 

The son of the family that works there is SOOOOOOOO pleasant. He's so nice, not overly nice, but he's kind and hardworking, and you want to come back.

Their Vietnamese sandwiches run out around lunch time, so you gotta get your order in before 12 or 12:30pm. Never had one before b/c I always lunch after 1pm.

Looks like they have a lot of low ratings from people who had their pho bowls, I've never tried the pho here before, but I am a fan of their lunch combos. 

My favorites are the bbq beef with vermicelli noodles and egg roll, or the bbq chicken with vermicelli noodles and egg roll. They also provide fish sauce and throw in some leafy greens with basil here and there and julienned carrots and some sprouts. The lunch combos always fill me up and satisfy. The deep fried egg roll is so good too. ($6.95)

The food comes out pretty fast and hot, so that I can get back to work pretty fast and have a nice hot meal. My only gripe is that I wish they were a block of two closer and I'd eat there more often. 

I would comeback for my fav. Combo meals and to maybe try their Vietnamese sandwiches if I can ever get a hold of one of them.
author: Irene C.

description:
they have great bbq pork. i've gotten a rice plate and a bahn mi and both were very delicious! the put some delicious sauce on the bahn mi sandwich that is super good!

i've also gotten the pho, which is meh. there's something off with the broth, in my opinion.
author: Marge S.

description:
Slightly better than Grab 'n Go, it is the default back-up choice when tensions arise over an outing to Grab 'n Go (i.e. if I put up enough of a hissy fit to not go but the group still has a pho craving). The pho is okay, very standard, but at least better than Grab 'n Go. It's a little more expensive; with tip I paid for a Combo Beef Noodle Soup at $8.90. Meh. Not surprised considering the location but it definitely could be cheaper.
Their spring rolls were not bad either, and overall the quality of their grilled meat rice plats and vermicelli bowls is good. This place isn't amazing in anything but it has decent service, there is plenty of seating, and the food is what you'd expect.
author: Jessica L.

description: Easily overlooked, this is the best bahn mi you can buy this side of the pacific. Michael should be canonized as a saint.
author: Rory O.

description: I like this place cuz it's close to my job and they're FAST! They have a nice variety or foods from Vietnamese to "American". The pho there isn't really what you see at a lot of other places. None of that big bowls of broth, it's actually Just the right size. The place is clean and the staff is really nice too! If your in the soma area it's woth checking out.
author: Will C.

description:
I eat here 3 times a week.  Forget the restrooms, the quality of the chairs, the menu, the wait staff, or the location on Bryant.  Just try these dishes here and tell me you don't think this place deserves 5 stars:

1. Chef's Salad with Grilled Chicken and Honey Dijon
2. Grilled Pork and Spring Roll w/ fish sauce over vermicelli
3. Barbequed Chicken w/ fish sauce over rice
4. Curry Chicken noodle soup
5. Pho Tai Nam (Pho w/ beef brisket and rare beef)

It's a family run business.  They've basically purchased the unpopular and slow Korso sandwich and coffee shop and within months and with limited resources, turned it into a hustle-bustle, packed-to-the brim, local Vietnamese lunch joint.  

I've seen what you've done- keep up the great work, Sunrise Cafe.
author: LibbyMcLibface _.

description:
great Bahn mi sandwich.  

Very friendly people working there.  I'd go back in a second!
author: Matt V.

description:
my boyfriend was craving something light so i decided to look for a vietnamese sandwich place. this place has awesome sandwiches and for $5, you can't beat the price! 

he got a pulled lamb sandwich and the meat was delicious. (i'm actually craving one right now..) i decided to get shrimp pho. it was pretty good but i could tell the shrimp were frozen (we live in san francisco, come on..) but that's my only real complaint. the broth was really good. i'm definitely coming back!
author: Alyssa L.

description: This place serves both American food and Vietnamese food, but I've only gotten the Vietnamese food here.  It's within walking distance to work, so I come here for lunch about once a week.  It's quick and cheap, and the food is pretty good.  It's cheap when compared to other food in the neighborhood, although it isn't cheap for Vietnamese food compared to the Sunset or San Jose.  I usually get the Beef Stew Noodle Soup, and they provide a pretty hearty portion. I also like the Vermicelli with Grilled Pork and Imperial Rolls.  I've also gotten the pho and seafood noodle soup here and both are decent. The food is really 3 stars, but due to the limited availabilty of lunch options in the area, I'm bumping it up to 4 stars.  I wouldn't eat dinner here as there are much better Vietnamese options in the Sunset, but for lunch, it will do just fine!
author: Tyler C.

description:
It was Saturday. I was hanging out in the patio area of the nearby Lone Star Saloon after a tough rugby match on Treasure Island. The team was sitting around, chatting and drinking $2 beers. A lonely beer was left unattended as one member left to get food from a nearby Vietnamese place.

She returned a while later with a white bag. She said "Anyone have $5 and want a BBQ pork sandwich?" I didn't even give anyone else a chance to reply! I was all over that sandwich. Maybe it was the beer or the fact that we just won a game or that the only thing I had eaten in 5 hours was honey nut cheerios, but that sandwich was amazing. The vegetables weren't as pickled as I usually like, but the meat was sweet and flavorful, not bland and chewy as it can be sometimes. One of the girls commented on how, as I ate the sandwich, my face looked like I was in heaven.
author: Molly C.

description:
stopped by here for lunch after i got released from jail.  good food.  better than the slop they served as at eight-fiddy.

just kidding.  i actually was looking for a place to grab lunch after i stopped by the credit union there and i just happened to notice this small little hole in the wall that served vietnamese food.  parking is a b in the area and you might run into a few "unfriendlies" but i think trying this place is definitely worth the risk.

i would give this place more stars, but it would seem unfair to the other places i've given more stars to since this review is based on the one dish that i had - grilled chicken w/fish sauce over rice.

the chicken was very flavorful...even without the fish sauce...probably due to it being well marinated.  the portions were good enough for me and at around $5.50, it hit the spot (that's what she said)

definitely gotta come back and try their other offerings next time i'm in the neighborhood, which i hope isn't soon.
author: Ray R.

description: BIG bowls of pho - hole in the wall for lunch, standard atmosphere for pho.  I compared the atmosphere to Turtle Tower.  The guy behind the counter seemed friendly.  This would be a good place to go for a quick cheap bite.
author: Charles C.

description: The veg banh mi are so good and so cheap! Agreed with other reviewers that the lightening/decor could be improved (looks like something out of a Duke Nukem scene), but still, ya get what ya pay for here. Definitely worth another visit!
author: M G.

description: Ordered #18 BBQ Shrimp spring rolls and noodles $8.15 so not worth it they only give you 4 little shrimp! At least it could have been 4 prawns but four little shrimp no way! I won't be back!
author: Nae B.

description: have been here quite a few times for lunch, everything here is usually made to order so its usually very fresh and hot. I usually order rice or noodle plates so I cannot vouch for their sandwiches. it gets crowded at lunch time so prepare to wait. but worth it.
author: Anton L.

description: Co-workers and I go to lunch here once a week. They have a large menu with lots of noodle dishes and soups, as well as vietnamese sandwhiches and burgers. Everything is delicious and the owners are really nice.
author: Maya W.

description: this place is bit expensive.  The egg rolls are okay, havent had the chance to try the pho yet.
author: Ann L.

description: Vietnamese sandwiches are good. Pork chop lunch special is good. The fried egg rolls (Imperial rolls) are good. Location is good, since it's only 1.5 blocks from work. Staff are friendly. Decor needs major work, but the food gets Sunrise 5 stars. Gotta say that So's restaurant better be crowded so I can come here as my #2 choice!
author: Marcus Y.

description: I am almost afraid to tell anyone more about this place, the lines are getting longer and longer.  Just ate there again , 2nd time this week its great.  The best Vietnamese sandwiches much better than the Siagon  place and this place is CLEAN!.  Had the humongous and delicious salad with chicken today...perfect.  The food is great and cheap and the staff is very friendly.  Must admit though the imperial rolls are good but I have had better (Tu Lan's can't be beat). However I think these are vegitarian unlike Tu Lan, but the sandwiches trully rock. On the way back to work at 850 stopped  up the block at 9th and Bryant the Motor Cafe on the corner has THE best chocolate chip cookies in the world.
author: rassors T.

description: As far as vietnamese sandwiches go this place is the best. The best flavored and seasoned pork and chicken of all the places including saigon sandwiches. Great bun fast friendly service and a nice thai iced tea made this the perfect experience for me. Bbq beef and chicken vietnamese sandwiches are the Bomb!!!
author: Joshua D.

description:
i've been craving some pho the past couple weeks (i know way too long to crave something without fulfilling it) and finally today for lunch the coworkers suggested vietnamese food! 

i was looking forward to finally getting my pho fill.  i browsed over the menu and they have a lot of options and descriptions for exactly what you're getting.  most of my coworkers got the vermicelli or a variation of it with beef, pork, and/or chicken.  i on the other hand went with the beef ball pho and a side of fresh spring rolls.  although the lady bringing the food out was confused (language barrier) i didnt get my rolls til after the older gentleman working came by to check on our table.  but the rolls came and boy were they fresh and tasty! i definitely would come back here and get the pho again.  the broth was definitely tasty and hit the spot.
author: omid a.

description:
Great place. Food is priced well.
Their Vietnamese sandwiches are my favorite in the city.
The older gentleman who works the counter is nice and friendly too.
author: Chuck D.

description: Damn good pho and amazing clay pot special! If you need a pick me up, if your car has been stolen, if your wife left you, don't worry, this clay pot will make you forget it all.
author: Christina C.

description: A friend of mine told me to go to the "SUNFLOWER" cafe and I thought he said the SUNRISE cafe, well that is where I ended up, and by surprise it was delicious and cheap and with good eats. My friends and I have been 4 days in a row, now tell me it aint good!!!!!!!
author: Yolanda M.

description: This is awesome restaurant. The owner (i assume) is very friendly and food is always good. I tried different meals every time and they are all good.
author: Junsoo K.

description: This place is a total dive, but the food is quite tasty and cost-effective. I love the spicy beef pho, and they're always happy to oblige my requests for more basil or peppers.
author: Jerry R.

description:
ridiculously good and surprisingly cheap
thats called value
great value...
author: Evan T.

description: this place is the most spacious hole in the wall i've ever been to.  the sandwiches, the spring rolls and the coffee are spot on. i love them all. not the cheapest hole in the wall establishment, but worth it.
author: Regina C.

description: I think this place is great!  I have had the super big salads and some of the bbq'd pork items.  The girls i work with go there at least twice a week!  it is a nice walk and gets us out of the office.  Not too many choices down here but i have to say many times on the way to the bridge I have wanted to stop and get a salad for dinner!  Everything is always fresh and ready to pick up!
author: S M.

description: So I gave them 2 more opportunities to impress me.  The wait staff was much more attentive and actually came to take our order at the table instead of the counter!  He even offered to pour us our water when normally you have to go to the back wall yourself and do it.  The food is good, as we only get the vietnamese dishes.  The last time I dined here, I had the pork chop with shredded pork and egg over rice.  I ate the whole thing minus some foliage left on the plate.  The sauce they give is the secret ingredient in making your rice dish magical.  All you have to do is drizzle it generously over your rice!  Abracadabra DELICIOUS!
author: Michael B.

description: I ordered their combination Pho (Pho Dac Biet) which was okay.  It was not the tastiest bowl of Pho I've ever had but it wasn't the worst either.  For what you get, the place is pretty pricey.  They do have a variety of Vietnamese dishes and sandwiches you can choose from.  The restaurant itself is very spacious for a Pho place.  They even have an extended dining hall in the back with a bathroom (which seems rare in the city).
author: R B.

description:
i'll keep it simple:

this place charges way too much for such poor quality.  

i'd rather go to Costco (around the corner) for hot dogs- then spend $10 on dog food
author: Suzanne G.

description: I like the food here.  There are not too many places within walking distance of work, so there are salads and yummy vietnamese food here.  Not the most authentic, but hey it's good and I like it.
author: C W.

description: The pho scene in SOMA is slooooowly growing.  After a dissapointing lunch at Grab-N-Go on 6th, my coworker and I decided to give this place a try.  The lack of a real menu makes ordering a bit confusing.  Most of the Asian dishes are written on paper, plastered throughout the restaurant.  We both had the old stand-by pho dac biet (combo beef noodle soup) and thought it was pretty okay - the best pho in SOMA (for now).
author: Allen L.

description: Have tried several Vietnamese sandwiches all over SF and Berkeley, including Saigon on Larkin St., but I am more convinced than ever that this is the best place for Vietnamese Sandwich! I guess it is the quality of their tofu which I find much better than that of most others. Sunrise has become once-a-week meal for me and my husband.
author: P T.

description: pretty good pho, service a little slow
author: Dennis K.

description: I love this place. ***** for the soups, salads and dishes. Full flavor broth and fresh meat. At $6-7, I can afford to eat here regularly during my lunch hour. Unfortunately, I have to give their sandwiches and Vietnamese coffee ***. Thus, the 4 star average. Pass on the coffee, and you'll have a 5 star lunch.
author: margie c.

description: I just happened to pass by here with my family while going to Costco and decided to give it a try.  The choices were very limited but everything was pretty good, expecially their BBQ items. Their Pho was prety good also.  As for the prices, it's actually not that expensive compared to the Tenderloin district, which I am very surprised about.  I thought it would be much more expensive being out in the middle of nowhere.  I would prefer to come here instead of Tenderloin becuase it's much easier to find parking here.
author: Raymond Y.

description: Sunrise Cafe was also most recently called Korso, and continues to operate under both names. Let me preface my review by saying I work near Sunrise Cafe, and it's proximity to my workplace is the only reason I continue to go there. I can't comment on any of the meat dishes as I am vegetarian, but the salads I've had there have been decent. You can order almost anything you want there as there is an Asian menu packed with various Pho options, and an American menu featuring dishes like hamburgers and sandwiches. Although I've never eaten in Sunrise Cafe, the dining area is relatively large so you're not sitting on a stranger's lap like other places. The service has always been fast, even when I popped in instead of pre-ordering by phone. The little man who seems to always be working is very pleasant and makes me feel appreciated for my business. In that area of SOMA, there are relatively few options, so I will continue to frequent Sunrise Cafe until something better comes along.
author: Breanna L.
